title: Heathrow takes aim at 'unhelpful' Willie Walsh
text:
Willie Walsh’s belief that Heathrow’s third runway is unlikely to go ahead has been labelled as “unhelpful” by a top executive at the airport.

Finance chief Javier Echave said that despite concerns raised by the boss of British Airways owner IAG, Heathrow is “cracking on” with the £14bn upgrade and “ramping up our investment”.

Mr Walsh said earlier this month that a combination of environmental concerns and spiralling costs mean expansion at Britain’s busiest airport was unlikely to proceed.

Responding to whether comments by Heathrow’s biggest customer were helpful, Mr Echave said: “Many things in life are not helpful. I can understand his position.”

description: Willie Walsh’s belief that Heathrow’s third runway is unlikely to go ahead has been labelled as “unhelpful” by a top executive at the airport.
